alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Harrison (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 1:33PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Doddridge and northwestern Harrison Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 133 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Union, or 14 miles southeast of Middlebourne, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Salem, West Union, Center Point, Sedalia, Canton and Wolf Summit. This includes Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 57 and 74. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
